column4: What is the best Wifi N accessory?  USB or PCI, matters not.  Do I need an antenna seperately purchased?
PCI cards are typically always better. You can use the antenna that comes with the card or purchase one separately if you really need one

Ok, found a PCI card that says it is supported Linux (I suppose that means every version, or at least Ubuntu), a DFE 530TX.  The question that I have for that card is whether or not I need to buy an antenna and whether it is a "draft N"  a N, a N150 or a N300 adapter
As I said, most cards some with an antenna already included
